title: URL Given leading to end users ending up in malicious sites

profile.name: Gratipay
profile.about: Gratitude? Gratipay! The easiest way for your company to pay for open source.

vulnerability_information:
Hi,

I found a design issue in the profile statement for the registered user. This is dependant on the end user however.

In the profile statement, one can write something as well giving links is allowed. This, I think is by design. However, let us suppose the authenticated user creates a website of his own which is basically a phishing page. Or he gives links to malicious websites.

Next he sends the link of his page to the victim. Try out this page.
https://gratipay.com/~www.google.com/.

Here the first link is to www.google.com. However, the next link is unknown and can be malicious.

Yes, this depends on the end user completely but I still think this is an issue.

Mitigation: Allow only alphabets or display the entire thing as text. The end user can copy paste the link in the browser if it is that relevant.

Thanks & Regards,
Dipmalya Pyne
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

I found a design issue in the profile statement for the registered user. This is dependant on the end user however.

In the profile statement, one can write something as well giving links is allowed. This, I think is by design. However, let us suppose the authenticated user creates a website of his own which is basically a phishing page. Or he gives links to malicious websites.

Next he sends the link of his page to the victim. Try out this page.
https://gratipay.com/~www.google.com/.

Here the first link is to www.google.com. However, the next link is unknown and can be malicious.

Yes, this depends on the end user completely but I still think this is an issue.

Mitigation: Allow only alphabets or display the entire thing as text. The end user can copy paste the link in the browser if it is that relevant.

Thanks & Regards,
Dipmalya Pyne

activities.message:
Hi,

Thank you for your report, the receipt of which we herewith confirm. We are currently verifying the issue you reported.

Please expect additional feedback from us within the next couple of days. The "INFORMATION SECURITY" section of the following page has additional, useful information regarding our platform's security: http://inside.gratipay.com/howto/manage-risk

We appreciate your interest in securing our platform and look forward to working with you.

Yours sincerely,
The Gratipay Security Team

activities.message: Another thing is that, the username can be modified to anything which does not include <>. As here, you can see my name is www.google.com. Just thought of letting you know.

activities.message: The second link leads to a website which can be completely malicious resulting in malicious software download, virus or some malicious link. The screenshot is attached.
activities.markdown_message: The second link leads to a website which can be completely malicious resulting in malicious software download, virus or some malicious link. The screenshot is attached.

activities.message:
Hi @ant_pyne,

Thanks for the report. Unfortunately, this is something we are already aware of. This is not a major issue and we have been working on implementing measures to protect our users for a while now: https://github.com/gratipay/gratipay.com/issues/4261. We are opensource, so if you would like to contribute to our project feel free to submit a pull request. ðŸ™‚

We look forward to more reports from you in the future.

Best regards,
Ed

activities.message: Why was this report closed when it was triaged and resolved? https://www.bugbountynotes.com/writeups/viewbug?id=3034
activities.markdown_message: Why was this report closed when it was triaged and resolved? https://www.bugbountynotes.com/writeups/viewbug?id=3034

activities.message:
Hi I would like to understand this. Why was it triaged and resolved? And it was closed as informative. I think I need to question the authenticity of the big bounty programs it this is what happens. I would be waiting for 2 days for a reply and after that any report closed as informative I would be sharing in my blog. 
I really need to understand what happened here. Could somebody please explain to me what happened here.

activities.message:
Hi @ant_pyne,

I cannot control what some third-party web application says about this report. This is most likely just a bug in Bug Bounty Notes. I would recommend contacting https://twitter.com/zseano, the author of that application, about this "triage and resolved" bug in their app.

\- Ed
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ant_pyne,

I cannot control what some third-party web application says about this report. This is most likely just a bug in Bug Bounty Notes. I would recommend contacting https://twitter.com/zseano, the author of that application, about this "triage and resolved" bug in their app.

- Ed

activities.message:
Hi @ant_pyne,

I reached out to @zseano and it should be fixed now. Just wanted to forward you @zseano's message.

>Hi there,
>
>Sorry for the confusion on BugBountyNotes with regards to the report. We scrape data from HackerOne on a regular basis and it was highlighted to us that we were marking reports as 'Resolved' when in reality some had been closed as Informative. We have made changes to our platform to reflect this and will work to fix the error on any other reports. 
>
>We recommend to always go by your report on HackerOne for final details about a report as we are merely just a third party platform.
>
>Thanks,
>Sean (zseano)

Hope that clears up any confusion.

\- Ed
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ant_pyne,

I reached out to @zseano and it should be fixed now. Just wanted to forward you @zseano's message.

Hi there,

Sorry for the confusion on BugBountyNotes with regards to the report. We scrape data from HackerOne on a regular basis and it was highlighted to us that we were marking reports as 'Resolved' when in reality some had been closed as Informative. We have made changes to our platform to reflect this and will work to fix the error on any other reports.

We recommend to always go by your report on HackerOne for final details about a report as we are merely just a third party platform.

Thanks,
Sean (zseano)

Hope that clears up any confusion.

- Ed
